title: Online Lecture Accessibility Design: Practical Application Based on Universal Design for Learning (UDL)

context.prior_knowledge: Advanced-level specialized knowledge in the field and extensive practical experience
context.additional_context: A teaching competency enhancement program for pre-service or in-service teachers. Emphasizes accessibility design capabilities applicable to real-world work for current practitioners.

learning_goals: Learners can create an online lecture content accessibility checklist with 80% accuracy using the UDL framework.
Learners can design three or more real-time video lecture environments compliant with WCAG 2.1 standards.
Learners can produce two or more customized learning materials (text, audio, visual) based on accessibility barrier analysis for specific target groups.
difficulty: Hard - Complex requirements with multiple constraints
